results.title: Fate of an empire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Shot in 1948, this film throws a somewhat accurate light on political/military discussions by administration from the four great powers on the future of the former Mussolini empire - Tripolitania, Cyrenaica, Eritrea and Somalia.

results.title: Fate of a child
results.creator_credit: Leo Seltzer and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: The death of a child is dramatised to show the living conditions in an under-developed area in Latin America. People surrounded by potential wealth live in poverty, starvation and ignorance. Technical assistance by the United Nations will help to eliminate the conditions responsible for the death of this child, through the economic development of such areas.

results.title: Fatal compromise
results.creator_credit: Josef Gemes and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description: A superbly animated production that details the lengths to which a love-smitten hedgehog will go in order to gain the attention of a rather large feline character. However the hedgehog does not quite get what it bargained for. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Fatal attraction
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer star in this gripping, if at times inconsistent thriller. A passionate week-end encounter ends Dan Gallagher’s perfect life. Alex refuses to be a woman scorned and her capacity for revenge and violence is without limit. The conclusion is unforgettably shattering as the nightmare draws to its inevitable “bloody” climax. Glenn Close gives an excellent, terrifying performance as the homicidal Alex as the film grapples with men’s subconscious fears about women.

results.title: Fat pizza
results.creator_credit: Paul Fenech, Tanith Carroll, Village Roadshow Pictures and Fat Pizza
results.brief_description: This Australian comedy, based on the SBS television show “Pizza”, has an irreverent anarchic flavour that is certain to (intentionally) offend. Pauly (Paul Fenech) is a pizza delivery boy who works for the explosively bad-tempered Bobo (Johnny Boxer); Pauly’s other main occupation is to drive about in his souped-up car, with its blaring sub-woofer stereo; meanwhile his friends Sleek (Paul Nakad), and Davo (Jabba) similarly cruise around in their own customised vehicle, encountering violent cops and sexually eager women. Fans of the series will recognise the vigour with which writer Fenech attacks sacred cows of Australian culture - principally, but not exclusively, the young male Lebanese/Australian racial stereotype - whilst applying a thick layer of infantile machismo and t&a humour. Certainly not to the taste of all, but quite original and daring in both concept and execution. Cast also incudes Annalise Braakensiek with cameos by Merv Hughes, Tim Ferguson, Jeff Fenech, Shane Porteous, Red Symons, Bernard King and Kamahl.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Fenech, Tanith Carroll, Village Roadshow Pictures and Fat Pizza

results.title: Fat pigs are out
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Jack Keane and Tony Doogood
results.brief_description:
Film follows a farmer as he foolishes fatens his pigs, only to discover on market day that ‘Fat pigs are out!’. He is then taken to an abattoir and shown the difference between fatty pork and the lean pork that the ‘modern housewife’ now demands.

Comical light-hearted tone throughout. Poor acting and dialogue. Good illustrated titles and ‘The End’.

results.title: Fat of the land
results.creator_credit: Baptist Pork Production in association with Civilian Tragedy
results.brief_description: A compilation of short British ‘art-house’ films 1984-1987 as follows: “Procar” (dirs. Richard Heslop, Daniel Landin), A Nosegay” (dir. Maggie Jailler), “Thou pluckest me out screaming (dir. Daniel Landin), “Epiphany (excerpt)” (dir. Certh Wyn Evens), “The Sluggard” (dir. Joy Perino), “Language” (dir. Richard Heslop), “Less then useless” (dirs. Richard Heslop, Carrie Kirkpatrick) and “The Conversation” (dirs. Timothy Burke, Richard Heslop)

results.title: Fat of the land
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Medcom and Searle Educational Systems
results.brief_description: Documentary on obesity, its causes and effects. Psychiatrists suggest that over-eating is a form of emotional disorder leading to addiction and that in the United States in particular, food has become symbolic as a state of well-being. It appears that children are actually encouraged to over-eat leading to difficulties in adult life to break the habit. The program’s main aim is to educate in the area of health and nutrition.
